meanings.definition: Stop or check the progress of something
meanings.sent1: The red light will arrest the cars.
meanings.sent2: The police officer had to arrest the speeding vehicle.
meanings.sent3: The sudden rain arrested our picnic plans.
meanings.sent4: Her captivating smile arrested his attention.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise arrested everyone's focus.

meanings.definition: Seize someone by legal authority and take them into custody
meanings.sent1: The police will arrest the thief.
meanings.sent2: The detective needed to arrest the suspect.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to arrest the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The melody arrested her emotions, bringing tears to her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The arresting officer swiftly took the criminal into custody.

meanings.sent1: The brakes will arrest the car's movement.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to arrest the noisy classroom.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick arrested the audience's chatter.
meanings.sent4: His powerful speech arrested the protest march.
meanings.sent5: The sudden applause arrested the speaker mid-sentence.
